result.execSummary:
The defendant Otto J Degler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay domestic abuse surcharge in the amount of $100

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--Complete a Certified Batterers Intervention programming, if recommended by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--The Defendant shall be subject to random alcohol and drug screening at the discretion of the Agent
--submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: WLPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otto J Degler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 10:21am [mo] 
Defendant Otto J Degler in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
recess: 10:22am--reconvene:10:28am [to allow ADA Shock to verify victim rights compliance; contact victim]
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
ADA Shock submits a Victim Impact Statement
Statement made by Mr. Degler

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--Complete a Certified Batterers Intervention programming, if recommended by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--The Defendant shall be subject to random alcohol and drug screening at the discretion of the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay domestic abuse surcharge in the amount of $100
--submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess:10:52am
Defendant's Demand & Motion for Discovery & Inspection

[MK] case called at 11:01am. 
Attorney David Zarwell in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Zarwell  verifies that the Defendant's date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived,
Defense stands mute.  Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $150 Cash (the amount originally posted was $350, so the clerk is to refund $200 to the surety), with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Melanie Degler
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor storeson 
--to report to the Clerk of Courts Office by 9/24/15 at 1:30pm to sign this bond. 
- to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 9/24/15 at 1:30pm.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 11:03am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/7/15 at 10:40am  (2)  Status Conference on 11/10/15 at 10:00am.
